channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge pothole, 6th February
item.description:
This is causing a lot of cars to be damaged, unless the swerve and nearly cause an accident. Please urgently fix.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Church Hill Road, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another large pothole, 6th February
item.description:
Large (30 cm wide) pothole which is damaging cars. Please fix To be honest, from the bottom of Parkside Gardens to Capel Road there are multiple dangerously large holes. Just as you did when the speed bumps were installed, the entire road should be closed for proper resurfacing. It will be cheaper and safer in the long run.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Church Hill Road, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked rainwater drain/gully, 6th February
item.description:
Drain blocked, puddle in road on a bend, cars passing spray the footway and pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halfway Street, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two 30cm potholes by the speed bump, 6th February
item.description:
By the speedbump past Avondale Road and towards East Barnet village, there are two wide and deep potholes. Cars try to avoid them but a serious collision is waiting to happen any day, when someone misjudges the speed of a vehicle in the opposite direction. The holes are getting larger with the persistent rain and those that do drive over them are damaging their vehicles. PLEASE FIX
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 170, Church Hill Road, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dip in the road after utilities work, 6th February
item.description:
After the utilities work (again), a large dip is present in the road. Not sure how this passed quality checking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meaford Way, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped tarpaulin in alley between Arsenal road and martin bowes road, 6th February
item.description:
Dumped tarpaulin has been left in the alley for 5 days
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arsenal Road, Eltham

item.title: Flytipped trash, 6th February
item.description:
This growing mountain of trash has been on the street and growing since Dec 2025. It was previously reported in Jan with several calls made to follow up and assurances by the council it would be dealt with only for the case to be closed with no resolution

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain Lancaster St, 6th February
item.description:
Water isn't draining. Suspect blocked drain. Lancaster St closer to Webber St end.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Lancaster Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Pavement by car club bay north side coram street between marchmont and herbrand streets, 6th February
item.description:
The sign is leaning precariously, probably as a result of a vehicle colliding with it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coram Street, St Pancras, Greater London

item.title: Communal Bins At Athelstan House, 6th February
item.description:
The communal bins used by Athelstan House residents aren't being collected properly and don't have lids on them. This leads to frequent incidents of animals taking rubbish out and spreading it all over the garden/children's playground - big hygiene issue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Londesborough Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another Blocked drain - Bucknall Street, 6th February
item.description:
Another Blocked drain - Bucknall Street. Outside the church, near estate agents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bucknall Street, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned lime bike, 6th February
item.description:
Bike has been left on pavement and is blocking up the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatcham Street, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Muddy curb, 6th February
item.description:
Is it possible to get a cleanup of the mud and leaf debris on the curb (and tree area) outside 3/5 Clock House Rd. I have seen someone slip on the mud so far, and the drains are not being well served either. The area is busy with parked cars after the parking restrictions (from 12:00 onwards), but if today [Friday] is anything to go by, a Friday between 09:30-11:30 seem to be a relatively quiet time after dropoffs from the childrens' nursery and the train station as well as the shops and gym on Beckenham Rd. Alternatively; can the council organising some form of blocking off of the parking for the work to be carried out properly [and even then, 'some people' will ignore no doubt]

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights still in place a week after road works were completed, 6th February
item.description:
Long traffic delays happening at the Stondon Park / Honor Oak Park traffic lights. This is because of temporary lights which are in place for no obvious reason. The roadworks ended a week ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stondon Park, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping Selsea place, 6th February
item.description:
Items of furniture dumped by bins. This was previously reported (ref 8810882) and only some of the items removed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Selsea Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Se10 9an, 6th February
item.description:
Hi, I am reporting an incident of fly-tipping located near my apartment in Greenwich. Several bulky items, including a mattress and pieces of furniture, have been illegally dumped on the [pavement/roadside]. â€‹Please note that these items do not belong to me; they were left here by an unknown person. As this is obstructing the area and constitutes illegal dumping, I am requesting the Council to investigate and clear the site.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pelton Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole in Winchester Place, 6th February
item.description:
A large pot hole (approximately the diameter of a car tyre) appeared in Winchester Place on Thursday 5th February 2026. This pot hole is in the centre of the road on Winchester Place opposite numbers 6 and 8. Please could this pot hole be filled in as soon as possible, as it is a danger to traffic passing up and down Winchester place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Winchester Place, Crouch End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement on Even no. side of road leathal when wet, 6th February
item.description:
The pavement is extremely slippy after rain. I think there is moss growing on the paving slabs. I have seen lots of people trip and fall over walking along this street section in the rain. Please could you jet wash the pavement. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burton Grove, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Plough Way, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Large fly tip of white bags, 6th February
item.description:
